articles.headline: A Diminished Hollywood Welcomes a New Mogul
articles.snippet: David Ellison is poised to soon run Paramount Pictures, among other entertainment assets. But what does that mean in a fractured cultural landscape?
articles.abstract: David Ellison is poised to soon run Paramount Pictures, among other entertainment assets. But what does that mean in a fractured cultural landscape?
articles.lead_paragraph: In 1994, when Sumner M. Redstone bought Paramount Pictures for about $10 billion, the equivalent of about $22 billion today, he did more than just take over a company. He ascended a cultural throne.

articles.headline: A Brand-New Electric Bus, No Charge. (That Was One Problem.)
articles.snippet: In tiny Wymore, Neb., a sleek new battery-powered school bus became a Rorschach test for the future.
articles.abstract: In tiny Wymore, Neb., a sleek new battery-powered school bus became a Rorschach test for the future.
articles.lead_paragraph: The matter before the school board was straightforward. The tiny school district in Wymore, Neb., needed a new school bus to replace one so old and beat-up that it was used only to ferry the football team back and forth to the practice field a few blocks away.
articles.byline: By Dionne Searcey and George Etheredge

articles.headline: What Happens When Your Bank Isn’t Really a Bank and Your Money Disappears?
articles.snippet: For unsuspecting depositors of online financial start-ups, the unraveling of a little-known intermediary has separated them from their life savings.
articles.abstract: For unsuspecting depositors of online financial start-ups, the unraveling of a little-known intermediary has separated them from their life savings.
articles.lead_paragraph: For close to a century, putting your savings into a federally insured bank has been a sure thing: If the institution fails, up to $250,000 of your money will be protected.

articles.headline: Cigarette Smuggling in Gaza Turns Aid Trucks Into Targets
articles.snippet: Organized looters are attacking aid convoys in search of contraband cigarettes, officials say, as needed aid languishes.
articles.abstract: Organized looters are attacking aid convoys in search of contraband cigarettes, officials say, as needed aid languishes.
articles.lead_paragraph: A new problem is bedeviling humanitarian aid convoys attempting to deliver relief to hungry Gazans: attacks by organized crowds seeking not the flour and medicine that trucks are carrying, but cigarettes smuggled inside the shipments.
articles.byline: By Aaron Boxerman and Natan Odenheimer

articles.headline: As Rich Backers Retreat, Biden Trumpets Small Donors
articles.snippet: The president is still seeking money from wealthy contributors even as he casts them as part of an unelected political elite trying to subvert the will of voters.
articles.abstract: The president is still seeking money from wealthy contributors even as he casts them as part of an unelected political elite trying to subvert the will of voters.
articles.lead_paragraph: In a nationally broadcast interview on Monday, President Biden pushed back on rich Democrats who want him to end his re-election campaign, saying, “I don’t care what the millionaires think.”
